Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is swept into an epic quest with dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: An epic fantasy about the struggle to destroy a powerful ring and defeat a dark lord.

Title: The Silmarillion
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A mythological history of Middle-earth describing the creation of the world and its earliest ages.

Title: A Game of Thrones
Author: George R.R. Martin
Description: A fantasy novel about noble families vying for control of the Iron Throne.

Title: The Name of the Wind
Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Description: A lyrical fantasy recounting the life of Kvothe, a gifted musician and magician.

Title: Mistborn
Author: Brandon Sanderson
Description: A fantasy novel set in a world where magic is fueled by ingesting metals.

Title: The Way of Kings
Author: Brandon Sanderson
Description: An epic fantasy about war, leadership, and honor in a storm-ravaged world.

Title: American Gods
Author: Neil Gaiman
Description: A fantasy novel blending mythology and modern America.

Title: Good Omens
Author: Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
Description: A comedic fantasy about angels and demons trying to stop the apocalypse.

Title: Dune
Author: Frank Herbert
Description: A science fiction epic set on the desert planet Arrakis, focusing on politics, religion, and power.

Title: Foundation
Author: Isaac Asimov
Description: A science fiction classic about preserving knowledge during the collapse of a galactic empire.

Title: Hyperion
Author: Dan Simmons
Description: A science fiction epic featuring interconnected stories and a mysterious being.

Title: The Left Hand of Darkness
Author: Ursula K. Le Guin
Description: A science fiction novel exploring gender and politics on an alien planet.

Title: Neuromancer
Author: William Gibson
Description: A cyberpunk novel about a hacker navigating a high-tech underworld.

Title: Snow Crash
Author: Neal Stephenson
Description: A cyberpunk novel exploring virtual reality and linguistics.

Title: The Martian
Author: Andy Weir
Description: A science fiction novel about surviving alone on Mars using science.

Title: Ender's Game
Author: Orson Scott Card
Description: A novel about a gifted child trained to fight an alien war.

Title: Blade Runner (Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?)
Author: Philip K. Dick
Description: A sci-fi novel questioning humanity through artificial life.

Title: Ready Player One
Author: Ernest Cline
Description: A science fiction adventure set in a virtual reality world.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian surveillance state.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A dystopian novel about a society obsessed with stability and pleasure.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A novel about censorship and the burning of books.

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: A dystopian novel about a theocratic regime controlling women.

Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy
Description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic world.

Title: Station Eleven
Author: Emily St. John Mandel
Description: A post-apocalyptic story about art and civilization.

Title: The Stand
Author: Stephen King
Description: An epic post-apocalyptic struggle between good and evil.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A novel about racial injustice in the American South.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A coming-of-age story about alienation and identity.

Title: East of Eden
Author: John Steinbeck
Description: A multigenerational novel exploring good and evil.

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Description: A war novel blending science fiction and satire.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A psychological novel about guilt and redemption.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A novel about wealth, love, and the American Dream.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: A sailor's obsession with a legendary whale.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A romantic novel exploring love and social class.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: A gothic romance about independence and love.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
Description: A dark romance about obsession and revenge.

Title: Outlander
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: A historical romance involving time travel.

Title: Gone Girl
Author: Gillian Flynn
Description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone wrong.

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Author: Stieg Larsson
Description: A mystery thriller involving secrets and corruption.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A fast-paced thriller involving religious mysteries.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Description: A horror novel about isolation and madness.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Description: A gothic horror novel introducing Count Dracula.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Description: A novel about creation and responsibility.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A philosophical novel about destiny and purpose.

Title: Meditations
Author: Marcus Aurelius
Description: Personal reflections on Stoic philosophy.

Title: Sapiens
Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: A nonfiction exploration of human history.
